text: Although M. hominis and Ureaplasma species can be cultured, this requires technical skill for interpretation of microscopic colonies and takes two to five days. U. urealyticum was the only Ureaplasma species until 2002, when U. parvum was described [4] . The two are not distinguished based on culture characteristics alone. Real-time PCR detection of these microorganisms from clinical samples circumvents technical issues related to culture and shortens turnaround time for detection and identification.
